comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content: Arthur Leslie Evans, son of Arthur Alfred Evans and Constance Mary Evans of 45 Forest Drive East, Leytonstone, London. No identifiable remains were recovered from the Somme battlefield. There is a memorial gravestone to him in the City of London Cemetery at Manor Park, Essex (presumably raised by his parents). On Thursday 20th July 1916 2nd Battalion Suffolks were fighting at Delville Wood near the village of Longueval having come forward in the morning with 76th Brigade to relieve South Africans from a brigade in 9th Division. Amongst numerous casualties suffered by 2nd Suffolks on that day, particularly in X and Y Companies, was 37-year-old Sergeant Arthur Page from Annesdale, Ely. See www.simonknott.co.uk/lifegoeson/people/002fmfpage.htm
